articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Mongolian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, president of Mongolia, on the occasion of the 92nd anniversary of the victory of the people's revolution in Mongolia .
					 The message wished the president and his people greater success in their work for the socio-economic development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 He expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily develop in line with the common interests and desires of the two peoples.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Mongolian PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Mongolian PM
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Noroviin Altankhuyag, prime minister of Mongolia, on the occasion of the 92nd anniversary of the victory  of the people's revolution in Mongolia.
					 The message wished the prime minister and government of Mongolia greater success in the work for the development and prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields of politics, economy and culture.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message of greeting to his Mongolian counterpart on the same day.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Syrian Charge d' Affaires A.I.
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Syrian Charge d' Affaires A.I.
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Haissam Saad, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Second Working-level Talks between North, South of Korea Held
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente mongol
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 9 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, con motivo del 92o aniversario del triunfo de la revolucion popular en Mongolia.
					 En la misiva, el remitente desea de todo corazon mayores exitos al destinatario y su pueblo en los trabajos para el desarrollo socioeconomico y la prosperidad del pais.
					
					  Expresa la conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Mongolia se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en el futuro conforme al interes y deseo comunes de los pueblos de los dos paises.

articles.title: Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House led by Director General and Editor-in-Chief Ji Yu Gon came back home Wednesday after wrapping up its visit to China.

articles.title: Reception Marks Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty
articles.content:
Reception Marks Anniversary of DPRK-China Treaty
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Central Committee of the Korea-China Friendship Association hosted a reception at Okryu Restaurant on Wednesday on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					 Present there on invitation were Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai, his embassy officials and other Chinese guests staying in the country.
					
					 Present there were Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk, chairman of the Central Committee of the association, and officials concerned.
					
					 Kang said in his speech that President Kim Il Sung and Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai signed the treaty 52 years ago, providing a legal basis for steadily developing the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 To develop these relations generation after generation is the behests of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He wished the Chinese people success in their efforts for defending the social stability and the sovereignty of the country, attaining the sustained economic development and winning a new victory in the socialist cause with the Chinese characteristics under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Xi Jinping as its general secretary.
					
					 Liu Hongcai said that the two countries have supported and closely cooperated with each other in the spirit of the treaty. 
					
					 He sincerely hoped that the Korean people would achieve bigger successes in the work to develop economy and improve people's living standard under the wise guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by First Secretary Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It is the steadfast stand of the Chinese party and government to steadily develop Sino-DPRK ties of friendship and cooperation, he said, adding:
					
					 We will together with the DPRK side mutually respect and believe and boost friendly exchange and cooperation and make efforts to promote the long, stable and sound development of the Sino-DPRK relations.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, in Ponghwa-ri, Kangdong County, Pyongyang and before his grave at Mangyongdae on Wednesday, the 119th anniversary of his birth.
					 Wreaths from the dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, were seen standing before the statue and grave.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were senior officials of the party, state and army, a chairperson of a friendly party and officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel and other people and school youth and children.
					
					 Laid before the statue and grave were wreaths in the name of the C.C., the WPK, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also placed were wreaths in the name of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, KPA units, revolutionary schools, educational institutions and party and power organs, enterprises and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute in memory of the revolutionary life and exploits of Kim Hyong Jik.
					
					 Floral tributes were paid to his statues at Kim Hyong Jik Military Medical University and in Sakju County of North Phyongan Province and Junggang County of Jagang Province on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK Men's Premier Soccer Matches End
articles.content:
DPRK Men's Premier Soccer Matches End
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Men's premier soccer matches came to an end. They were part of the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize. 
					 In the first and second rounds footballers turned to good account Korean-style tactical system and methods.
					
					 Finals between the Hwaebul Team and the Team of the Ministry of Light Industry took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Wednesday.
					
					 The Hwaebul Team beat its rival 2:1, placing first in team standing.

articles.title: DPRK Players Bag Medals in 27th Universiad
articles.content:
DPRK Players Bag Medals in 27th Universiad
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK weightlifters are proving successful at the 27th Universiad now under way in Kazan, Russia.
					 In women's 63 kg category on Tuesday Pyon Yong Mi succeeded in lifting 100 kg in snatch and 133 kg in clean-and-jerk. She came top with a total lift of 233 kg, thus setting a new Universiad record.
					
					 Earlier, Paek Il Hwa and Cha Kum Chol bagged silver medals in women's 48 kg category and men's 62 kg category respectively while Choe Hyo Sim a bronze medal in women's 58 kg category.

articles.title: Soldier-builders of Skiing Resort Inspired with Aid Materials
articles.content:
Soldier-builders of Skiing Resort Inspired with Aid Materials
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Many units, people of various circles and school youth and children in different places of the DPRK have rendered positive help to the soldier-builders of the Skiing Resort on Masik Pass.
					 Officials and other people of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Supreme Court, Korean Revolution Museum, General Bureau for Service for People and others procured lots of aid materials and visited the construction site to raise the morale of the soldier-builders.
					
					 The Cabinet, State Planning Commission and the Ministry of Metal Industry organized well the work of the relevant units to supply materials to the construction site, making the public officials turn out in the work for assisting the army.
					
					 Officials of the Ministries of Post and Telecommunications, Chemical Industry, Culture and Light Industry also presented aid materials to the soldier-builders and helped their work, encouraging them.
					
					 The hot wind of assisting the army is raging among the people in Kangwon Province to render fraternal help to the soldiers creating the new history of change in their province.
					
					 Officials and other people in Pyongyang, South Hamgyong, South Phyongan, North Hwanghae, Jagang provinces and Nampho City are dedicating all their sincerity to aiding the construction of the skiing resort.
					
					 Good deeds are done by the new generation, notably students of Changdok School in Pyongyang and Kalma Junior Secondary School in Wonsan City. They gave aid materials they sincerely procured with their families to the soldier-builders and requested them to hasten the construction.

articles.title: Nature-remaking Project Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Nature-remaking Project Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A project for reclaiming the Sepho tableland to be a giant stockbreeding base has made headway at fast speed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The 600-meter-above-sea-level tableland, covering tens of thousands of hectares in Sepho, Phyonggang and Ichon counties, is now being turned into artificial and natural grass fields.
					
					 The reclaimers applied new methods to speeding up the project, which began in December last year, unfailingly carrying out weekly and monthly assignments.
					
					 They have manured grasslands with slaked lime and organic fertilizer and built up windbreaks.
					
					 Precedence has been given to road construction in the project.
					
					 The project includes the building of skiing and sleighing grounds, race course, ecological park, hostels and service facilities.
					
					 Inspired by the "Masikryong Speed", the builders there are putting spurs to carrying out the project, part of the grand nature-remaking plan of the Workers' Party of Korea, ahead of schedule.

articles.title: DPRK Experiences Heavy Rainfall
articles.content:
DPRK Experiences Heavy Rainfall
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Heavy rain, caused by rainy front gaining momentum in the central part of the Korean Peninsula, has swept through Pyongyang and Nampho cities, South Phyongan, North Hwanghae and South Hamgyong provinces and some areas of Kangwon Province, starting Tuesday night.
					 According to data available, it rained 157 mm in Hoechang County, 149 mm in Sangwon County and 140 mm in Pyongyang City from 18:00 Tuesday to 12:00 Wednesday.
					
					 There are reportedly more than 30 localities with over 100 mm rainfall up till now.
					
					 Sukchon County witnessed 56 mm rainfall from 00:00 to 03:00 Wednesday, Hoechang County 84 mm, Pyongyang City 73 mm, Sungho County 68 mm, Yangdok County 65 mm and Onchon County 58 mm from 03:00 to 06:00 and Munchon City 44 mm from 07:00 to 08:00.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Whole Life Devoted to Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Whole Life Devoted to Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime had worked heart and soul for achieving national reunification.
					 At every stage of developing situation, he advanced aboveboard and reasonable policies and proposals for national reunification.
					
					 In April 1948, he convened a historic joint conference of representatives of political parties and public organizations in the north and the south of Korea, calling for unity of all the patriotic forces.
					
					 In the latter half of the 1940s and 1950s, he made public such works as "On the Building of New Korea and the National United Front" and "Against the Elections of a Reactionary Separate Government in South Korea and for the Achievement of Korea's Reunification and Independence" to stress the idea of achieving the great unity of the nation.
					
					 Especially, when the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime were desperately working to make "two Koreas", he published the works "On the Three Principles of National Reunification", "Let Us Prevent a National Partition and Reunify the Country" and "On the Five-Point Policy for National Reunification".
					
					 In the works, he clarified the issue of achieving the national reunification in an independent and peaceful way, not dependent on armed forces or outside forces, as well as the issue of realizing the great national unity, irrespective of differences in ideology and social system, to reunify the country.
					
					 In the 1980s and 1990s, he put forth the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the Ten-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation, the embodiment of the Three Principles of National Reunification which was confirmed in the July 4 North-South Joint Statement. 
					
					 From Juche 79 (1990) to 1994, he authored "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation", "Let the North and the South Open the Way to Peace and the Reunification of the Country in a United Effort" and other works, which gave impetus to the national reunification movement.
					
					 On July 7, 1994, a day before his death, he examined a document concerning the national reunification issue and left his signature on it.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Publishes Many Works during War
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Publishes Many Works during War
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung published many works in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War to lead the army and the people of the DPRK to victory.
					 In such works as "Let Us Wipe Out the Invaders by a Decisive Counter-Offensive" and "Go All Out for Victory in the War", he specified the nature of the Korean War and set forth the idea of waging it as an all-people resistance. 
					
					 "On Duty of Military Commission" and "Present Situation and Immediate Tasks" reflect the strategy of the President who led the war to victory by holding the initiatives at all times with his original strategy and tactics.
					
					 "Conclusion at the Third Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea" and "On the Policy for Future Development of the Workers' Party of Korea" and other works expound the tasks and ways for strengthening the party organizationally and ideologically and increasing its function and leadership role as required by the wartime.
					
					 Strategic and tactical policies calling for creating Korean-style military tactics and putting them into practice are expounded in the works "We Should Fight with Our War Methods", "On Organizing Aircraft-Hunting Teams" and "On Organizing Teams of Snipers".
					
					 The works "Let Us Strengthen the People's Army", "On the Orientation of the Armistice Talks" and "The Prevailing Situation and Tasks of the People's Army" indicate the operational policies and tasks for smashing all offensives and ulterior aim of the imperialist allied forces and winning a decisive victory in the war.
					
					 Other works indicate the orientation and ways for accelerating the wartime production to achieve the victory in the war and deal with popular policies. Some also expose the U.S. imperialists' policy of aggression and their brutal nature and set forth the policies for creating international circumstances favorable for the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Spurring Implementation of Tasks Set Forth in New Year Address
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Spurring Implementation of Tasks Set Forth in New Year Address
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday editorially calls upon the people to put big spurs to the advance of a great surge and thoroughly implement the important tasks set forth by the dear respected Kim Jong Un in the New Year Address just as they recorded great achievements in the first half of the year.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The address clearly sets forth the purpose and tasks to be attained in the effort for building a thriving nation this year and fully indicates the principled issues and ways for realizing them. 
					
					 The address fully reflects the determination and will of the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu to bring about a decisive turn in building an economic power and improving the people's living standard this year. That is why it serves as an inspiring banner that instills redoubled strength and courage into the army and the people of the DPRK.
					
					 Signal events and proud achievements were made in the first half of the year.
					
					 The DPRK is not afraid of any formidable enemies and has no fortress insurmountable as Kim Jong Un leads the anti-U.S. confrontation and the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 It is the revolutionary spirit of the army and the people of the DPRK to rock the earth when the leader knocks on the wall and to respond lightning with thunder.
					
					 The Korean people have performed proud feats startling the world for half a year as the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu has energetically led them with ardent enthusiasm as the standard-bearer of the advancing ranks.
					
					 They should put spurs to the effort for thoroughly implementing the tasks set forth in the address, not being contented with the successes already achieved.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Creating Conditions for Lasting Peace
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Creating Conditions for Lasting Peace
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- It is necessary to create conditions and circumstances for ensuring lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article on Wednesday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and its allies are working hard to brand the DPRK as a harasser of peace in a bid to justify their anti-DPRK moves and attain their sinister aim. But such a base method can never work in today's bright world.
					
					 The U.S. has pulled up the DPRK over its nuclear deterrence, claiming that the world peace is being threatened by the DPRK. It is, indeed, a far-fetched assertion.
					
					 The real criminal who disturbs the world peace is none other than the U.S.
					
					 What the U.S. seeks in continuously staging the largest-ever joint military exercises and increasing the frequency and intensity of the drills is not only to target the DPRK but also to contain its surrounding countries by force of arms in order to bring the Northeast Asian region and the rest of the world under its control. This is the U.S. ultimate goal.
					
					 To defend the world peace, it is necessary to remove the danger of a nuclear war that lingers on the peninsula.
					
					 To this end, it is prerequisite for the U.S. to roll back its policy of hostility towards the DPRK, sign a peace pact with the latter and withdraw all its nukes and troops from south Korea.
					
					 It is essential to dismantle all nukes on earth and put a complete end to any nuclear threat to any country.
					
					 The U.S., which is threatening the DPRK with nukes, should be held responsible for the situation on the peninsula which has not yet been denuclearized.
					
					 If the U.S. truly wants the peace, it should stop making such ridiculous remarks but behave itself with a proper attitude.

articles.title: Korean People Will Always Advance with Chinese People: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Korean People Will Always Advance with Chinese People: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung together with Premier Zhou Enlai of China signed the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance on July 11, 1961. This was the expression of the fixed will of the Korean and Chinese peoples to boost for all ages the DPRK-China friendship sealed in blood.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The treaty has made great contribution to the development of the DPRK-China friendship whose validity and vitality have been fully displayed for over five decades. 
					
					 The Korean people are rejoiced as over their own over the fact that all things go well in China and extend wholehearted congratulations to the Chinese people. 
					
					 It is the steadfast stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to develop the DPRK-China relations of friendship and cooperation, precious wealth common to the two peoples. 
					
					 The WPK and the DPRK government and people will always advance hand in hand with the Chinese people in socialist construction and the struggle to defend peace and stability in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world. 
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship with excellent tradition and firm legal foundation will be everlasting down through generations as it has stood the test of history. 
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship deeply rooted in the hearts of the two peoples will steadily grow stronger by their joint efforts.

articles.title: S. Korean Unification Ministry Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire: KCNA
articles.content:
S. Korean Unification Ministry Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire: KCNA
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean Unification Ministry spokesman talked a load of rubbish about the DPRK which decried the remarks of rattling its nerves made by the present chief executive of south Korea during her foreign trip.
					 Uttering such words as "inappropriate expressions and remarks" and "a regretful thing", the spokesman again talked about "sincere dialogue".
					
					 Those who made remarks provoking the DPRK even abroad are now shamelessly taking issue with it over its language.
					
					 Their sophism aimed to evade the responsibility for the frayed inter-Korean ties only shows their plight of being driven into a tight corner inside and outside.
					
					 As already reported, the south Korean regime's smear campaign against the line of the DPRK on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force was a vicious provocation to hurt the dignity and social system of the DPRK. This only reveals their ignorance of politics.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the international community, when touching to the reckless remarks by the chief executive of south Korea, called her watchword of "confidence-building process" an empty word and commented that the prospect of de-escalating the tensions on the Korean Peninsula and warming the inter-Korean relations remains dim.
					
					 They should know that their continued repetition of their master's assertions inciting confrontation will bring them only shame and contempt.
					
					 The issue of the "confidence-building" and "sincerity" for dialogue should be raised by the DPRK.
					
					 The recent revelation of the south Korean puppet Intelligence Service's interference in the "presidential election" is casting doubt about the legality of the present chief executive of south Korea as "president."
					
					 South Koreans from all walks of life are describing "the election of Park Geun Hye as president" as a "coup" that lacks confidence and sincerity, demanding her resignation.
					
					 With the revelation of the plot to rise to power that came under fire by the broad segments of south Koreans, the regime forced the IS (Intelligence Service) to open to public the minutes of the inter-Korean summit, claiming "the necessity to probe the truth about the political disputes".
					
					 However, this action resulted in the sharp fall of the supporting rate for Park and "the Saenuri Party".
					
					 This serious development threw Park and her party into extreme uneasiness.
					
					 This casts doubt as to whether there truly can be a confidence-based dialogue with the present south Korean regime which has hardly won any trust from its people.
					
					 Worse still, the regime made no scruple of opening to public the minutes, which must be respected to the maximum, in order to attain its sinister political aim. Here can one think it was sincere when it claimed the "summit diplomacy"?
					
					 A saying goes that out of the mouth comes evil.
					
					 The more recklessly the south Korean regime resorts to the smear campaign against the dignity and social system of the DPRK, the more miserable fate it will meet.

articles.title: GIs' Criminal Acts Flayed
articles.content:
GIs' Criminal Acts Flayed
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) ? The People's Action for Peace against War in south Korea held a rally outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, Seoul on July 6 denouncing GIs for committing crimes, polluting base and forcing south Korea to increase the share of the upkeep of the U.S. forces.
					 At the rally speakers condemned the GIs for committing ceaseless crimes against south Koreans such as assaulting a taxi driver inside running cab.
					
					 They urged the police and prosecution authorities to make a swift and thorough-going investigation into the GIs' crimes and sternly punish the criminals.
					
					 Referring to the U.S. military base in Ryongsan getting seriously polluted, they demanded an investigation into all areas within the base to correctly grasp the status quo and take a step for restoring it to its former glory.
					
					 The U.S. is forcing south Korea to increase the share of the upkeep of the U.S. forces, in particular, an unreasonable act of forcing the other to pay a fabulous amount of money, the speakers said, calling for the abrogation of the special agreement on sharing the upkeep of the U.S. forces.

articles.title: Investigation into IS's Interference in Politics Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Investigation into IS's Interference in Politics Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Council of Professors for Democracy in south Korea demanded a thorough-going investigation into the case of the Intelligence Service's interference in politics, according to the CBS of south Korea on Monday.
					 The organization denounced the IS's organized involvement in the election as a serious politically-motivated crime.
					
					 Unpardonable is undemocratic and senseless act of opening to public the minutes of the south-north summit on the part of the IS to cover up the case of its interference in politics, it charged.
					
					 It demanded a thorough-going investigation into the case.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Urged
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The South Kyongsang Provincial Progressive Federation and the Pusan People's Solidarity held a rally in Jinhae in South Kyongsang Province on Monday strongly demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea.
					 At the rally speakers said that the danger of war is increasing on the Korean Peninsula due to the ceaseless war maneuvers by the U.S. forces, deploring their plight under such situation.
					
					 The Intelligence Service's opening to public of the minutes of the south-north summit has sparked off a furor in south Korean society, a product of disgraceful division of the nation, they held.
					
					 The U.S. forces present in south Korea turned Jinhae port into their military base, the port which was built by the Japanese imperialists to meet their greed for aggression, they said, adding there are many such military bases in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. is a country which cannot exist without war, they said, noting that it is ridiculous for the U.S. to talk about human rights and democracy.
					
					 The U.S. forces are present in south Korea to kill civilians and reduce this land into a theater of war, not to help south Koreans, they said, calling for having the U.S. forces withdrawn at an early date.

articles.title: Portrait of Smiling Kim Jong Il Displayed at Mongolian Institute
articles.content:
Portrait of Smiling Kim Jong Il Displayed at Mongolian Institute
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il was displayed at the "Gor King-Erdene" Institute of Teachers of Mongolia on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia.
					 The event took place at Kim Jong Il Class in the institute on July 4.
					
					 Present there were teaching staff of the institute.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia and his embassy officials.
					
					 Ch. Jyachin, director of the institute, said that he deems it honor to have the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il displayed at the institute.
					
					 He added:
					
					 The Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il is a great idea to be followed by all of us.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un is leading the DPRK along the way of Juche with confidence, true to the intentions of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will keep deep in our hearts the honor of having Kim Jong Il Class in the institute and positively study and disseminate the Juche idea among Mongolian people.

articles.title: Remembrance Meetings Held Abroad
articles.content:
Remembrance Meetings Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Mongolia, Indonesia and Denmark on July 3 and 4 to commemorate the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The executive chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society and the general director of the HUM Company Ltd. praised Kim Il Sung as tender-hearted father revered by not only the Korean people but the progressive mankind.
					
					 They said that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries have steadily developed under the deep care of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They stressed that the friendly relations between the two countries being invariably carried forward by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un would grow stronger through diverse exchange and cooperation.
					
					 The secretary general of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia noted that Kim Il Sung was a great thinker and theoretician and greatest man who made great contributions to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The secretary general went on:
					
					 There were a number of state leaders who visited Indonesia but no one has ever received such warm welcome from the Indonesian people as the one he enjoyed.
					
					 At that time President Sukarno named a newly cultivated flower after Kim Il Sung and presented it to him. This shows well how great Kim Il Sung was.
					
					 The chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association said that Kim Il Sung devoted his all to the Korean revolution and global independence after embarking on the revolution in his early years.
					
					 He stressed that the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung before mankind will be immortal along with the era of independence.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Denmark.

articles.title: Figure of Democratic Congo Praises Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Figure of Democratic Congo Praises Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The secretary general of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo released a statement on July 3 to commemorate the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 He said:
					
					 The great revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung is further shining day by day as he performed unprecedented sacred exploits in realizing emancipation of humankind and cause of independence.
					
					 Kim Il Sung, who possessed extraordinary insight, strong and bold will and distinguished capability, embarked on the road of revolution in his teens, led the Korean revolution to victory and in this course founded the great Juche idea to open up the era of Juche, the era of independence.
					
					 The Juche idea awakened peoples in many countries of the world who suffered from exploitation and oppression by the imperialists, led them to the way of struggle and inspired them with conviction that they could win in the revolutionary struggle.
					
					 Today the truth and vitality of the Juche idea have clearly been proved through the situation of the DPRK.
					
					 The Juche idea serves as a precious heritage of the progressive mankind as it is the most valuable revolutionary theory for the emancipation of human being.
					
					 The world progressive people will value the immortal exploits performed by Kim Il Sung who illuminated the way ahead of the 20th century and positively struggle for building a peaceful and equal new world against the high-handed and arbitrary practices of big powers in the international arenas.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Praise Invincible DPRK
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Praise Invincible DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on July 5 to mark the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The statement said as follows:
					
					 Rumors about "change" in the DPRK were rampant in the world after the demise of the President.
					
					 The U.S. and its satellite forces, in particular, schemed the "collapse" of the DPRK while the pro-U.S. south Korean conservative forces made all sorts of provocations against the DPRK, claiming "change in social system".
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il solemnly declared to the world that nobody should expect any change from him.
					
					 Under his leadership the President's revolutionary cause was successfully carried forward in all fields.
					
					 After the sudden demise of Kim Jong Il, the imperialists, reactionaries and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea miscalculated that there would be a "change" in the DPRK.
					
					 Socialist Korea, however, is constantly advancing.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un, identical to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, is successfully carrying forward the preceding leaders' Juche-oriented revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 Socialist Korea will display invincibility in the future, too, and triumphantly make its way through all hardships thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Korean people will certainly build a thriving nation and carry out the cause of national reunification without fail under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is carrying forward the grand aims of the great Generalissimos.

articles.title: Korean People's Victory in War Marked in Switzerland
articles.content:
Korean People's Victory in War Marked in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War made public a statement on July 2.
					 The statement noted that Koreans were the first to defeat the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The month of anti-U.S. joint struggle this year is of great significance as it marks the 60th anniversary of Koreans' victory in the war against the U.S., it said, and went on:
					
					 July 27 is a glorious anniversary to the Korean people on which they won the war with the U.S. imperialists 60 years ago.
					
					 The DPRK, a small country, defeated the U.S. that boasted of its "mightiness" and this was a historic event that greatly inspired the people all over the world struggling for national liberation and social emancipation.
					
					 The Koreans are now staging a dynamic struggle to withdraw the U.S. imperialist aggression forces and nuclear weapons from south Korea and achieve national reunification.
					
					 The present U.S. government should respond to the DPRK's reasonable proposal for dialogue and come out to the talks for concluding a peace treaty.
					
					 We, confident of the sure victory of Koreans in the north and the south and abroad in their just struggle for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops and national reunification, would conduct solidarity activities to support them.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente mongol
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente mongol
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 9 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, con motivo del 92o aniversario del triunfo de la revolucion popular en Mongolia.
					 En la misiva, el remitente desea de todo corazon mayores exitos al destinatario y su pueblo en los trabajos para el desarrollo socioeconomico y la prosperidad del pais.
					
					  Expresa la conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Mongolia se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en el futuro conforme al interes y deseo comunes de los pueblos de los dos paises.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete con motivo del 52o aniversario de tratado RPDC-China
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete con motivo del 52o aniversario de tratado RPDC-China
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 52o aniversario de la firma del Tratado sobre la Amistad, Cooperacion y Apoyo Reciproco entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Popular China, el Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y el Comite Central de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China ofrecieron este miercoles un banquete en el Restaurante Okryu. 
					Fueron invitados el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica china en Corea y los huespedes chinos que estan de visita en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes el ministro de Salud Publica y presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China, Kang Ha Guk, y otros funcionarios coreanos. 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, Kang dijo que hace ahora 52 anos, el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el premier Zhou Enlai firmaron el tratado referido que devino la base juridica para consolidar constantemente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises. 
					
					Desarrollar esos vinculos generacion tras generacion es el legado de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, puntualizo. 
					
					Deseo que bajo la guia del Partido Comunista de China encabezado por el estimado Secretario General Xi Jinping, el pueblo chino logre exitos en la lucha por defender la estabilidad social y la soberania del pais y alcanzar el desarrollo economico sostenible y nueva victoria en la causa socialista con peculiaridades chinas. 
					
					Liu se refirio a que en periodos pasados ambos paises vinieron apoyandose y cooperandose estrechadamente segun el espiritu del tratado.
					
					Deseo sinceramente que bajo la sabia guia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea dirigido por su Primer Secretario camarada Kim Jong Un el pueblo coreano logre mayores exitos en el desarrollo de la economia y la mejora de vida del pueblo.
					
					Anadio que el partido y gobierno chinos mantienen la inconmovible posicion de consolidar y desarrollar incesantemente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea. Expuso la voluntad de esforzarse junto con la parte coreana para promover el desarrollo prolongado, estable y sano de las relaciones China-Corea al respetar y confiar reciprocamente y ampliar el intercambio amistoso y colaboracion.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a Kim Hyong Jik con motivo de su nacimiento
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a Kim Hyong Jik con motivo de su nacimiento
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 119o aniversario de nacimiento de Kim Hyong Jik, indoblegable combatiente revolucionario y destacado dirigente del movimiento antijapones de liberacion nacional de Corea, fueron depositadas este miercoles las ofrendas florales ante su estatua de bronce erguida en la comuna de Ponghwa del capitalino distrito de Kangdong y su tumba en Mangyongdae.
					 Estaban colocadas en respectivos lugares las ofrendas florales enviadas por Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En las ceremonias para colocar las ofrendas florales, participaron los cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las organizaciones de masas, los ministerios y organos centrales, asi como los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea,  trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares.
					
					Fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales en nombre del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC.
					
					Se colocaron las otras en nombre de las organizaciones de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, unidades del EPC, escuelas revolucionarias, instituciones docentes, asi como los organos del partido y el Poder, empresas y granjas en esta capital, etc.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de la vida revolucionaria de Kim Hyong Jik y sus imborrables proezas.
					
					El mismo dia, fueron depositadas las ofrendas, ramos y ramitas florales al pie de las estatuas de bronce de Kim Hyong Jik erguidas en la Academia de Sanidad Militar Kim Hyong Jik, el distrito de Sakju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte y el distrito de Junggang de la provincia de Jagang.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun aboga por paz duradera de Peninsula Coreana
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun aboga por paz duradera de Peninsula Coreana
Pyongyang, 10 de julio (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este miercoles, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala la necesidad de preparar las condiciones y el ambiente por la paz duradera de la Peninsula Coreana, y continua:
					Estados Unidos y las fuerzas satelites intentan justificar sus maquinaciones anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y lograr su malsano proposito tildando a la RPDC de destructor de la paz.
					
					Pero, tales metodos no surtiran efecto en este mundo tan claro.
					
					El imperio yanqui habla ridiculamente de que la paz mundial es amenazada por el disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC aunque es autor de la amenaza a la paz mundial.
					
					Intensifica en la Peninsula Coreana la frecuencia y la intensidad de los ejercicios militares conjuntos de gran envergadura.
					
					Su proposito final es mantener a raya con las fuerzas a la RPDC y otros paises vecinos y realizar la ambicion de dominar la region del Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo.
					
					Para defender la paz mundial hay que eliminar el peligro de la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana, punto de combustion de la guerra nuclear.
					
					EE.UU. debe abandonar su politica hostil anti-RPDC, firmar con la RPDC el acuerdo de paz y retirar del territorio surcoreano todas sus armas nucleares y tropas.
					
					Hace falta eliminar todas las armas nucleares de toda la Tierra y acabar por completo con la amenaza nuclear a otros paises.
					
					EE.UU., amenazante nuclear a la RPDC debe asumir la responsabilidad por no realizarse la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Si EE.UU. desea de veras la paz, no debe pronunciar disparates absurdos sino cumplir sus  deberes merecidos.
